title: Implement LLVM codegen for GRIN expressions (store/fetch/update/case/app)
body:
Implement LLVM code generation for all GRIN expression types.

**Deliverables:**
- `Store` → call runtime `alloc`, write tag + fields to heap
- `Fetch` → load tag + fields from heap pointer
- `Update` → overwrite heap cell with new node
- `App` → generate function call (direct call for known functions)
- `Case` → LLVM `switch` on tag, branch to alternatives
- `Bind` → sequence operations, bind results to variables
- `Pure` → return a value
- Handle GRIN patterns in case alternatives (tag matching, variable binding)
- Integration tests: compile and run simple GRIN programs via LLVM

**Design notes:**
- `store`/`fetch`/`update` call into the Zig runtime for heap management
- Case on tag uses LLVM's `switch` instruction
- For M1, only direct (known) function calls are needed; indirect calls come with `eval`
